title: Emmerdale spoilers: Devastating aftermath for Aaron after Robert's exit
text:
Aaron Dingle (Danny Miller) is set to be left a broken man following the exit of Robert Sugden (Ryan Hawley) from Emmerdale – and Lucy Pargeter has warned that the character could slip back down a dark path with his history of depression and self harm.

After the death of rapist Lee Posner, Aaron and Robert made the decision to flee upon realising there was no realistic prospect of Robert getting a lenient sentence. And while we can’t reveal what splits Robron apart, Aaron will end up back in the village – and feeling hollow and distraught without his soulmate.

Speaking about Chas’ fears for her son, Lucy shared: ‘She’s worried about his state of mind, she’s worried about what could happen to Aaron, as in his self harming or his depression or going off the rails. That’s always in the background. She’s offered her help, she’s tried to be strong and said right get over him you need to move forward and try to be there for him, so she’s quite concerned about his mental state.’

It’s not just Aaron that she is anxious about either. After giving birth to her new baby – in the Woolpack toilets of all places – Lucy reckons that Chas will be quite an anxious and paranoid mother to the newborn at first.

She pondered: ‘She will be a little more fearful, more wanting her baby monitor next to her constantly and maybe a movement pad underneath and a breathing thing on her and I think she will be by her side every minute that she can.

‘She’s starting back to work straight away so the baby will be with her behind the bar. Like any mum, that paranoia of I’ve got to keep looking at her and waking her up and checking on her, but they know that there’s nothing physically wrong with the baby. She’s going to be slightly more paranoid but hopefully as the months go on, they settle in to parenthood and things will calm down a bit.’
